abstracts.cdata!:
The Federal Water Resources Management
            Project will support the development of water resources
            management capacity at the Federal, State and user levels,
            and the implementation of the necessary infrastructure to
            ensure optimal resource utilization in order to address both
            water supply and demand management issues of ten States in
            the Northeast and the Federal Government (National
            Secretariat of Water Resources - SRH). A summary of the
            major adverse impacts associated with stages of deployment
            and operation are summarized thus: 1) importation of
            diseases, risks of pollution of water resources (municipal
            sewage and solid waste), etc; 2) loss of plant cover,
            erosion of soil, changes in topography (crater), noise
            emissions and dust, risks of accidents; 3) damage to the
            genetic heritage of flora and the habitat of fauna,
            increasing the processes of erosion and silting of water
            resources; risk of injury to venomous animals and so on; and
            4) average risks of salinization and pollution of water
            dams, and risks of lifting the water table.
